name: Traditional Dishes
description: Classic Myanmar meals loved by everyone.

foods.name: Mohinga
foods.description: A flavorful rice noodle soup in fish broth with lemongrass and herbs — Myanmar’s beloved national dish.

foods.name: Shan Noodles
foods.image: image/ရှမ်းခေါက်ဆွဲ.jpg
foods.description: A popular Shan dish of rice noodles topped with seasoned chicken or pork, tomatoes, and garlic oil — simple yet full of flavor.

foods.name: Si Hta Min
foods.description: A traditional Burmese golden sticky rice cooked with turmeric and coconut milk, often served with fried fish or dried shrimp.

foods.name: Burmese Tofu
foods.description: A traditional Shan dish made from chickpea flour — smooth, creamy, and often served warm or fried with tangy sauce.

foods.name: Nan Gyi Thoke
foods.description: A thick rice noodle salad mixed with rich chicken curry, roasted chickpea powder, and flavorful Burmese spices.

foods.name: Ohn No Khao Swè
foods.description: A rich Burmese coconut noodle soup with chicken, egg noodles, and spices — served with lemon, egg, and fish sauce.

foods.name: Burmese Biryani
foods.description: A fragrant rice dish cooked with spiced chicken, cardamom, and cloves — a Burmese twist on classic biryani with rich flavors.

foods.name: Mont Phet Htok
foods.description: A traditional Burmese snack made of steamed sticky rice with a sweet coconut filling wrapped in banana leaves.

name: Street Foods
description: Tasty snacks found on every corner of Myanmar.

foods.name: Samusa
foods.description: Crispy pastry filled with spiced vegetables or meat, a popular snack in Myanmar.

foods.name: Mont Lin Ma Yar
foods.image: image/မုန့်လင်မယား.jpg
foods.description: Famous crispy rice flour snacks cooked in round molds.

foods.name: Mont Lone Yay Baw
foods.description: Famous crispy rice flour snacks cooked in round molds.

foods.name: Pork Sticks
foods.description: Delicious marinated pork skewers, grilled to perfection over charcoal.

foods.name: Myanmar Dosa Style
foods.description: Thin crispy pancake, often served with chutney or curry.

foods.name: Myanmar Tempura
foods.description: Crispy fried vegetables and seafood, a favorite street snack in Myanmar.
